required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Multiphase and Monophasic Arterial Hepatic MRI in the Detection of Arterial Enhancement of CHC Nodules
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Multiphase and Monophasic Arterial Hepatic MRI in the Detection of Arterial Enhancement of CHC Nodules in Cirrhotic Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
The detection and diagnosis of hepatocellular carcinoma is a public health issue. MRI is the most sensitive examination for diagnosis and especially hypervascularization in the arterial phase.
Several studies have shown that MRI multiphase arterial sequences are superior to single phase to capture the arterial phase. The purpose of this study is to compare arterial enhancement sensibilities between multi and single phase sequences.

primary_outcome.description: significant arterial enhancement present in one of the three phases of multiphasic arterial time compared to all other arterial phases or single phase

study_pop.textblock: patient followed up for cirrhosis with discovery of a suspicious CHC nodule during imaging monitoring

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient included in CHIC study with histology of hepatocellular carcinoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- nodules already treated by chimioembolization
